column4: i need help with the following "E subprocess  script returned error exit status 2 linux image 2.6 20 16 generic"
could you paste the entire error to pastebin?
i'm willing to help, just need every line from when you type until it ends
sec, i'm finally reading it (i get distracted easy sometimes)
okay, are there any other 2.6.20 image packages? apt-cache search linux-image 2.6.20
and what CPU do you use?
oh, it's a laptop. who makes it and what's the model?
okay, if you type this: apt-cache search linux image 2.6.20   do you get any results that contain 686, i686 or p4?
basically what you want to do is to find a kernel that is best suited for your CPU so that it will run more efficiently and thus faster
i'm guessing that's why you want to upgrade your kernel :)
alright, go for the x86 one then, if you install it, dpkg should then 'forget' about the generic one
yeah, i'd try installing linux-image-2.6.20-16-386 and see if it produces the same error
sorry about that, you can actually pin a package so that it won't use something else
